author: Hamish Mackay
title: Jurgen Klopp is a great coach but his position at Liverpool is not beyond question - he is responsible for their form
text:
Get Liverpool     
Monday night marked the nadir of Jurgen Klopp's time at Liverpool. 
The team he inherited in October 2015 was far from perfect: there were question marks over almost every defender while the debate surrounding first choice goalkeeper Simon Mignolet seemed — unfortunately for him — to have already been settled. 
But Klopp's arrival brought a wave of optimism and an upturn in fortunes. While there were poor performances along the way, Klopp's first 15 months saw a steady improvement in the side. 
The past two, however, have born witness to a collapse. Liverpool have won just two of their 12 games in 2017 and have gone from Chelsea's main title challengers to 14 points off the top of the table. 
Twice this month they have faced sides in the relegation zone and lost. On top of that they took 180 minutes to beat League Two Plymouth in the FA Cup and were then dumped out by Championship side Wolves in the next round. Liverpool players during their defeat by Leicester City (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Liverpool are a team lacking in ideas and devoid of confidence. Monday's 3-1 defeat away to struggling Leicester was the lowest point of Klopp's reign, but the slide has not yet been arrested. 
They face Arsenal, who are a point ahead of them with a game in hand, this weekend in an encounter that could easily end in a heavy defeat. 
Speaking after Liverpool's latest horror show, Klopp admitted: “It's getting more serious now. We all play for our futures, myself included." 
Klopp is great coach and a charismatic guy, but he is right when he says his future is not certain. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
